The claim was made by Gov: Andrew M. Cuomo at a student rally for the Orthodox Union, an organization advocating for the Orthodox Jewish community.
Gov: Cuomo stated that he has given religious schools in his budget more money than ever before in history.
The state provided close to: 192 million for non-public schools in last year's budget, which includes reimbursement for state mandates, attendance costs, school safety equipment, and academic support services.
State aid to private schools has almost: Cuomo took office, with the most money given before his tenure being $128.4 million in the 2007-2008 budget.
